column2: NORTH DAKOTA PERMIT TEST
column4: North Dakota
column6: ND

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead
column6: Steep grade ahead
column8: Slippery road ahead

column2: 2. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.

column2: 3. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column6: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column8: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column10: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control

column2: 4. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: activate your stop lights.
column6: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column8: brake suddenly.
column10: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 5. To help relieve fatigue on a trip:
column4: stop for a rest every two hours.
column6: change feet on the gas pedal.
column8: drink coffee frequently.

column2: 6. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column6: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column8: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.

column2: 7. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the time of day.
column6: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 8. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column6: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column8: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 9. The sign in the picture:
column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 10. You are approaching a railroad crossing and the crossing signals are flashing. You should:
column4: slow down and look for a train.
column6: look for a train, then speed up.
column8: stop and look for a train.
column10: do what the approaching vehicle does.

column2: 11. When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
column4: signal your intentions ahead of time.
column6: make sure the lane you are about to enter is clear.
column8: check your blind spots.

column2: 12. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column6: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column8: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column10: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.

column2: 13. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column10: wait for the next green light.

column2: 14. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column6: No, never.
column8: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 15. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column4: black
column6: white
column8: orange

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad Crossing
column6: One Way
column8: Limited parking

column2: 17. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: flash your lights.
column6: sound your horn.
column8: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column10: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.

column2: 18. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column6: Wrong way.
column8: Do not enter.

column2: 19. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: defensive driving
column6: road rage
column8: furious driving

column2: 20. A few drinks after work before driving home:
column4: are acceptable as far as they are part of your daily routine.
column6: should be avoided unless you really need them.
column8: have no effect on your driving ability.
column10: should be avoided because they impair your judgement.

column2: 21. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column6: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column8: To halt the traffic flow.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 22. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column4: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.
column6: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.
column8: in spring.

column2: 23. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Winding road

column2: 24. Broken white lines can be crossed over:
column4: when it is safe to change lanes.
column6: at any time.
column8: only in passing zones.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn is not permitted
column6: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column8: A left turn can be made only after stopping
